result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Lee Hackney

records.addlTxt:
4:16 PM Defendant Brandon Lee Hackney appeared by phone, in custody at MMHI.  Attorney Jack Alan Umpleby appeared by phone for Brandon Lee Hackney.  Attorney Claudia T. Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
All appearances by phone. Set up for zoom, but unable to proceed with zoom due to Deft not able to hear the Court.
Preliminary hearing questionnaire & waiver filed. 
Court reviews Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire with Deft.
Deft requests to speak w/Atty Umpleby.
(Court goes off record)
4:30pm - Court recalls.
Deft had enough time to speak w/Deft.
Probable cause found/Deft bound over.
Atty Umpleby requests separate Arraignment date.
Arraignment scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Arraignment on November 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Jack Umpleby is appointed as counsel.
Repayment is to be determined at the end of the case. 
$100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court.
